synopsis.text:
Ishinomori Manga Museum has released an animated short, "Kawaru Machi, Kawareru Machi, Ishinomaki feat. Jun," directed by Takuya Inaba and inspired by Shotaro Ishinomori's semi-autobiographical and wordless manga, "Jun: Shotaro no Fantasy World." The short is a tribute to Ishinomori's hometown of Ishinomaki, which is still recovering from the devastating Tohoku earthquake and tsunami of March 2011.

The anime is a hand-drawn art animation, with no dialogue, only music and sound effects, making it accessible to people of all ages and nationalities. The story follows Jun, a character based on Ishinomori himself, as he navigates through the recovery of Ishinomaki City. The anime superimposes Jun's journey over the city's ongoing rebuilding efforts, conveying a message of hope and resilience in the face of adversity.

The anime is a visual representation of Ishinomaki's recovery, with Jun's growth symbolizing the idea that even in difficult situations, dreams can come true if one does not give up. The anime is a heartwarming tribute to the city's strength and determination, as well as a testament to the power of art to inspire and heal.
